thing-type.label: FGT001 Thermostatic Valve
thing-type.description: Thermostatic Valve<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtFIBARO Heat Controller is a remotely controlled thermostatic head to control temperature in the room. It measures the temperature and automatically adjust the heat level. It can be mounted without tools on three types of thermostatic radiator valves. It is also possible to create schedules via app to easily manage temperature throughout the week. <br /&gtMain features:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtto be installed on three types of valves: M30 x 1.5, Danfoss RTD-N and Danfoss RA-N,</li&gt <li&gtcompatible with any Z-Wave or Z-Wave+ Controller,</li&gt <li&gtsupports Z-Wave network Security Modes: S0 with AES-128 encryption and S2 with PRNG-based encryption,</li&gt <li&gtbuilt-in battery recharged through standard micro-USB port,</li&gt <li&gteasy installation - no tools required,</li&gt <li&gtcan use dedicated temperature sensor,</li&gt <li&gtsupports heating schedules,</li&gt <li&gtautomatic calibration,</li&gt <li&gtanti-freeze function,</li&gt <li&gtdecalc function,</li&gt <li&gtunconstrained rotation spherical knob to set desired temperature.</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtAdd the device to the Z-Wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtMake sure the device is within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller in (security/non-security) add mode.</li&gt <li&gtUse the included key to quickly triple click the button on the thermostatic head.</li&gt <li&gtThe LED ring will start blinking white.</li&gt <li&gtIf you are adding in S2 authenticated mode, type in the device pin code (underlined part of the public key on the label).</li&gt <li&gtWait for the adding process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful adding will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtTo remove the device from the Z-Wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtMake sure the device is within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller into remove mode.</li&gt <li&gtUse the included key to quickly triple click the button on the thermostatic head.</li&gt <li&gtThe LED ring will start blinking white.</li&gt <li&gtWait for the removing process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtFIBARO Heat Controller is a FLiRS device. The FLiRS device alternates between sleep mode and a partially awake mode in which it is listening beam signal. When device receives this beam, it immediately fully wakes up and then communicates with the controller or other Z-Wave device.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_4
parameter.label: 1: Override Schedule duration
parameter.description: Duration of Override Schedule after turning knob<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines duration of Override Schedule after turning the knob while normal schedule is active (set by Schedule CC).</p&gt <p&gtUnits = minutes</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_4
parameter.label: 2: Additional functions
parameter.description: This parameter allows to enable different additional functions of the device.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter 2 values may be combined, e.g. 1+8=9 means that Open Window Detector and LED indications when controlling remotely are enabled.</p&gt <p&gt1 (bit 0) - enable Open Window Detector</p&gt <p&gt2 (bit 1) - enable fast Open Window Detector</p&gt <p&gt4 (bit 2) - increase receiver sensitivity (shortens battery life)</p&gt <p&gt8 (bit 3) - enabled LED indications when controlling remotely</p&gt <p&gt16 (bit 4) - protect from setting Full ON and Full OFF mode by turning the knob manually</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_4
parameter.label: 3: Additional functions status (READ-ONLY)
parameter.description: This parameter allows to check statuses of different additional functions.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter 3 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means optional sensor works properly and open window detection was triggered.</p&gt <p&gt1 (bit 0) - optional temperature sensor connected and operational</p&gt <p&gt2 (bit 1) - open window detected</p&gt</p&gt
